授業目的: The purpose of this course is to practice academic English skills such as critical thinking, researching, synthesis, and writing. You will be allowed to explore a topic of your choice in English. You will write and present your topic in an academic way. The fall semester will focus more on argumentation and persuasive writing. Topics such as rhetoric and logical fallacies in argumentation will be discussed in detail.
到達目標:
Students will be able to:
- read authentic texts and react to them in written and oral discussions(topics include fake news and digital literacy, materialism, ethics of meat eating, and the ethics of gene editing)
- synthesize information on a variety of topics
- learn source methodology and how to choose good sources
- practice and learn critical thinking skills
- learn researching skills (finding sources, determining source reliability, citing sources using APA 7th edition, avoiding plagiarism)
- Choose a controversial topic
- write an argumentative, source-based, paper on a topic of your choice
- make academic presentation based on your research paper
授業方法: Lectures, in-class research, in-class discussion, small group work, out-of-class research. Classes are conducted face-to-face in the classroom. The online class participants will receive: online simultaneous interactive delivery during class time.
